Title: Mid Software Developer
Description: A full stack developer for the labs department of SOIN. Acting as a Tech Lead for TramiteYA, an innovative platform designed to drive digital transformation. TDCar, CrearEmpresa and DGME rely on TramiteYA to revolutionize and streamline procedure handling and tracking through a cutting-edge digital solution. • Continuously develop new features and enhancements for TramiteYA using JavaScript, Node.js and React. • Offer technical support to users of TramiteYA, addressing issues and troubleshooting problems to ensure smooth operation of the platform. • Lead innovation processes within the development team and estimate the time and resources required for new developments of features. • Use Git and GitHub for version control, managing code changes and collaborating with other developers. • Responsible for and actively participate in the deployment process of delivering new product features to production, collaborating closely with DevOps and release management teams.

Title: Mobile Mid Staff Developer
Description: A mobile developer for the labs department of SOIN, the innovative R&D branch of the company. • Develop new features and give support to Tapp: a proprietary mobile application to boost customer retention by providing businesses an out of the box loyalty program experience. • Attend and prepare conferences about technology breakthroughs to stay posted about the latest trends. • Be prepared to tackle projects on either Android or iOS. • Research and adapt to cutting edge mobile app development approaches: Kotlin, Flutter. • Maintain great communication with the design team to achieve the best design withouth compromising functionality. • Mantain good version control habits: branching, tagging, descriptive commits, pull requests, forks, remotes. • Build continuos integration processes and proactivelly improve them in order to automate repetitive application building processes.

Title: Junior Software Developer
Description: An Android developer for the health department of SOIN, a company with over 30 years of experience developing tecnology solutions. • Develop new features and give support to EDUS: a mobile application owned by Caja Costarricense del Seguro Social (CCSS) made available by the government nationwide in order to facilitate access to health record and other public health services. • Develop new features and give support to SIFF: an internal mobile application owned by CCSS developed exclusively for tablets to record public health related information and generate a census of the country condition. • Maintain great communication with the design team to achieve the best design withouth compromising functionality. • Work as an outsourcing partner: stay in constant communication and deliver good solutions designed to fit even with external developers. • Mantain good version control habits: branching, tagging, descriptive commits, pull requests, forks, remotes. • Build continuos integration processes and proactivelly improve them in order to automate repetitive application building processes. • Actively use tools to scan for applications bugs or code scanning to improve accessibility, security, performance and usability. • Write descriptive and concise external documentation of application architecture, methods calls and user flow.

Title: Manatí + MyPlanet Fellowship
Description: Completed the 2019 Fellowship program, hosted and operated by Manatí in partnership with Myplanet.  A fullservice digital agency in Costa Rica combined efforts with a software studio based in Toronto to put together a program where we learned and put to practice: • Agile practices, Scrum, backlogs, definition of done, priorization. • Web development frontend fundamentals: HTML5, CSS3. • Drupal 101: introduction, backend development, custom modules, theming, headless, REST API configuration and fundamentals. • React 101: server side vs client side, rendering, structure, const, let, maps, objects, props.  To deliver a fully functional proposal for a home page of a non profit organization named TeenSmart International.

Title: Frontend Web Developer
Description: Part of the web development team of Trambia, the first company in Central America to become a Silver Partner of HubSpot in less than 6 months, responsible for: • Develop and implement code and front-end web design. • Work on multiple projects and comply with deadlines. • Write clean and elegant code. • Make wireframes or mock-ups of new and existing websites. • Thrive in an atmosphere of constant change with new technologies.
